item.title: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance For PC
item.dc:creator: mankyman6
item.description:
I like the port except so far except for one little issue. Whenever I set the game to fullscreen 1080p it puts black borders around the entire display.

There was one guy on the steam forums who was hit with the same issue, but it doesn’t seem like there’s much to do about it at this point except set it windowed mode. At least with that there isn’t as big of a border.

Read full topic

item.source: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance For PC

item.title: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance For PC
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
This game came out today and I’m playing it right now. The port is fairly decent but still a bit limited in terms of settings. You can choose from several resolutions up to a max of 1920x1080 locked to 60fps. We’re talking true framebuffer resolutions unlike the Dark Souls port. Anyway, the people who play on screens above 1080p and 120hz are pissed because of that and while durante seemed to have figured out how to unlock the resolution, it messes up with the hud and he doesn’t seem sure that he can fix that. However, Platinum seems to be listening to the issues and we might see a patch later down the road.

Other than that, it runs great and looks a bit better than the console versions.

Hope it sells enough to convince Konami to port MGS5 to PC.

Read full topic

item.title: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance For PC
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
One thing that I’ve been seeing is that Dark Souls actually had the frame buffer locked to 720p and it upscaled or downscaled as necessary. MGR apparently actually natively supports a bunch of different resolutions up to 1080p so it’s possible to change it. So maybe if it isn’t available in the actual menus, it will be available in a file somewhere. Hopefully.

Read full topic

item.title: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance For PC
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Well, it’s not like people aren’t complaining. The Deadly Premonition guys are all aware of Durante’s fix and the community’s reaction to the poor port. In fact they even contacted Durante directly, so an official fix might come out of that?

As for MGR, let’s see, people are already voicing their concerns on twitter directly to Platinum and Konami, so maybe there’s still time for a day-one patch.

Read full topic

item.source: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance For PC

item.title: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance For PC
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Besides Capcom, and maybe a few others, the Japanese games industry has next to no clue about PC gaming standards, not to mention the lack of experience in making PC ports.

Dark Souls PC came out of a team with very little experience on PC gaming, and they had a very tight schedule and budget to make a proper PC conversion, so that’s why the port came out very basic.

Deadly Premonition PC had it even rougher, with a game engine that was already not up to snuff on consoles.

But I think things are improving somewhat, Japan has seen how well PC gamers responded to both Dark Souls and Deadly Premonition, and the MGR pre-orders are out the roof, so I bet future ports will be better. We’re already seeing that with Dark Souls 2, which leads on PC.

Read full topic
item.source: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance For PC

item.title: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance For PC
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
So I’ve been hearing rumors that the game maxes out at 1920x1080 and you can’t go higher. Not sure how true it is but it sucks if it is true. Why are so many games coming out with resolution locks? Not locking the resolution seems like one of the easiest things to do.

At least it’s better than locking it at 720p like Dark Souls.

Read full topic

item.title: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance For PC
item.dc:creator: Dreadmoth
item.description:
Kairouseki:

Skyrim technically had a cap at 60 fps. You could remove it but it would cause the physics to do weird things.

Blasted Skyrim

Framerate too low? Screwed Y-axis mouse sensitivity (might have been fixed since I played it last).

Framerate too high? Screwed physics (someone I know died from stepping on a bone…) and game timer.

Read full topic

item.source: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance For PC

item.title: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance For PC
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
I’m wondering that as well. They said that they’re targetting 60 fps still for the PC version. I wouldn’t imagine that if they were already going for 60 fps on consoles they would develop is with a necessary frame cap, but anything’s possible. It’s not like it would be the only game like that. Skyrim technically had a cap at 60 fps. You could remove it but it would cause the physics to do weird things. If it is capped at 60 I won’t be bothered with it and there might be a DSFix-ish thing to allow it to go higher.

Preordered it. Can’t wait. Especially can’t wait to mess with the Zangeki setting, or whatever it’s called, allowing you to raise the amount of cutting debris I suppose before things start disappearing, which I hear is near instant on consoles.

Read full topic
item.source: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance For PC

item.title: Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance For PC
item.dc:creator: Diabolical
item.description:
Oh regarding this game I was ranting about on this thread a moment ago.
Here is a system requirements that you need to play this game:

Minimum:
OS: XP or Vista or 7 or 8
Processor: Intel Core i5 2400
Memory: 2 GB RAM
Graphics: Nvidia Geforce GTS 450
DirectX: Version 9.0c
Hard Drive: 25 GB available space
Sound Card: DirectX compatible sound card

Recommended:
OS: XP or Vista or 7 or 8
Processor: Intel Core i7 3770
Memory: 4 GB RAM
Graphics: Nvidia Geforce GTX 650
DirectX: Version 9.0c
Hard Drive: 25 GB available space
Sound Card: DirectX compatible sound card

https://store.steampowered.com/app/235460/

Read full topic
